result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven J. Younger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: FTE/schooling or combination thereof, or for any week defendant does not meet that requirement, he must complete 9 hours community service per week.

No contact with victim. 

PO to make decision on absolute sobriety.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven J. Younger

Clerk Cheree
Cases 16CF37 and 16CF38 called: 8:49am
State appears by ADA R.Uttke; Defendant appears in person with Atty Daniel Cveykus.

State notes defendant has already entered pleas in 16CF37 (Ct. 1) and 16CF38 (Cts. 1 and 2).
M.Y.W. (victim) makes statement.

Argument by counsel on probation length

COURT ORDERS:
16CF37 - Ct. 1 (Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area)
16CF38 - Ct. 1 (Failure to Support Child/120 days+/Repeater)
16CF38 - Ct. 2 (Failure to Support Child/120 days+/Repeater)

ON ALL COUNTS ABOVE>> Sentence W/held on all 3 counts; 3 years Probation on each count, concurrent.
CONDITIONS:  Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO (PO to make decision on absolute sobriety ; Restitution (amount to be determined - State to file within 60 days); No contact with victim; FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or for any week defendant does not meet that requirement, he must complete 9 hours of community service per week; CC; DNA surcharge (sample has already been give); Conditional jail time 16CF37 Ct. 1 only>> 365 days MCJ w/credit for 455 days of time already served.
